Description: Limestone stela; pediment at the top; panel of Greek text naming Moyses; cross below. Description in Hall: One akroterion broken off; gable contains two vine leaves. Panel with inscription, the name of the deceased: below this a cross pattée and two palm branches, signifying that he was martyred for the faith. Below this a rectangular panel containing a large cross with a P-loop on the right of the upper arm, forming the 'crux monogrammatica': in each of the four spaces between the arms is a simple incised cross; in two upper spaces α and ω also.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.134, Pl.94)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 94:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
